content.description: Climb the obvious offwidth crack splitting the LHS of the wall, for 3 bolts, before moving R onto the short crack system above.
content.protection: 5x fixe glueins 3.5" to fixe staple and 1x 3.5". A7 adhesive

content.description:
Just L of babyfood. Climbs the obvious OW crack on the LHS of the wall to reach the 1st bolt then head straight up, via some hard moves to easier climbing in the groove above.

"The angels can fly, because they take themselves lightly"

G. K. Chesterton
content.protection: 5x fixe glueins 3.5" to fixe staple and 1x 3.5" anchor. A7 adhesive

content.description: overhanging wall R of chastity via some hard moves after the 3rd bolt. F7c
content.protection: 6x 10mm x 150mm glueins, to anchors. 1st bolt needs a clip stick

content.description: short groove R of shred or dead
content.protection: 3 powers ps 10mm expansion bolts to 1/2" PS fixe chain

content.description: Start on right pinch and left two finger slot. Do a desperate move to one stand start holds and continue up the v5. Incredibly low percentage
Stand Start on left side with ok right hand pocket move left to crimp and move up pockets and crimps to the right. left arete is off for this route (will try to make one with it on)
content.location: Route is by the base of baby food. A overhung boulder with a few features.

content.description: Easy warm up slab using the aretes makes it about V0 without it is V2
content.location: Boulder to the right of pop rocks

content.description: the obvious slab in front of you when descending down the gully with main wall to your R.
Begin route in the deep pit on the right side arete of the Opposite Main Wall.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor approximately 10 feet down from the top of the Opposite Main Wall.  TR project, no lead bolts.  Access TR with trad pro from the top of the Opposite Main Wall.
content.location: Route is located right of Abstinence on the right side arete of the Opposite Main Wall.

content.description: route L of gateway drug, Good first route for the day..
Start up abstinence for one (new gluein) bolt. Head Right to the arete. Finish up a wall with water runnel/heucos. Crux at the 4th bolt, then one more hard move after, so be careful or you might fly!
content.protection: 4x fixe 3/8x 6" to SS Fixe Trad anchor
content.location: farthest route R on this wall. Obviously, If u are climbing on unbrushed rock you are off route. Feel free to bring a brush and give it one!

content.description:
This route is located directly opposite of Spread Eagle.  It is near the entrance to the cave routes, located on the left side pillar.

This route was a TR route for many years, but was difficult to access.  It was bolted and led in 2012 with expansion bolts in poor quality limestone, giving it a bad reputation as dirty and dangerous.  After two solid seasons with minimal rain and heavy use from the locals, it has cleaned up quite nice and now it has new glue ins to make it that much more safe.

Start on the right side arete and trend toward the left to reach the large owl hole, then go straight up for a more challenging climb.  You can cheat around the left side arête to the anchors if you start to sketch for a .10a finish .  The direct adds a letter grade or two for a 5.10b/c
content.protection:
5 new "2015" Fixe stainless steel 1/2" X 6" glue-ins with A7 glue thanks to Dan H.

2 open cold shuts with a 3rd bolt between them with a delta link for a backup on the lower off.

content.description: First route you see, left side of wall. 3 bolts, chains/bolts at the top. Great fun easy route with surprising holds (theyre all bomber) and great flow. Typically the first climb most newbies do. Limestone classic.
content.protection: 3 Bolts to anchor chains with quick links.
content.location: Opposite the Main wall first route on the left.

content.description: The furthest route Left. Climbs the entrance gully for a couple of moves before heading R along a short crack, then back left to climb the Left arete, via some smeary moves, with the crux move where it should be, at the top.
content.protection: 5x 3.5" fixe glueins with A7 to fixe staple and 3.5" for anchors

climbs.name: Abstinence
climbs.fa: Paul Bernard, Dustin Brown, and Addison Cory

content.description: Route to the right of Baby Food, obvious chains anchor at the top. Starts either on the rock resting against the wall, or for added difficulty, just down and to the right of it. Little mossy/chossy at first..feel free to clean as you go!

Climb the chandelier-like flakes to reach the 1st bolt. Continue climbing up the gap between the large calcite formations to exit right onto large flakes and a final battle with small holes and calcite flows to the anchor.
content.location:
"3 Vets" begins 10 ft right of Baby Food.

Bet

ween Baby Food and Abstinence.
